register.note: Whatever the settings in bits 5-4 of bytes 1 and 2, the registers holding the two passwords (`02FE` and `02FF`) can never be read back, and the [Inventory](../Inventory) and [License](../License) registers (`0200` to `020F`) are always readable. When the "Protect admin key and sensitive registers" bit in bytes 1 (Local) and 2 (Remote) is set, the *HostCommAdminKey* and the registers 02F0 to 02FF (including this Access Conditions register itself) can be changed only after an authentication using *HostCommAdminKey*. field.name: Innovatron T0 ATR
field.description: Innovatron Contactless cards return their T=0 ATR over interface (APGEN/REPGEN). Some legacy applications rely on this ATR to recognize the card, which is different from the PC/SC-specified ATR.
field.remark: Using this option is known to break the compatibility with some implementations of the PC/SC stack (the card has a T=0 ATR but uses T=1 Case 4 APDUs, which is considered as a protocol violation by the stack).

option.title: Obey to PC/SC rule and construct a T=1 ATR, even for Innovatron Contactless cards
For Innovatron Contactless cards, use the T=0 ATR supplied by the card

field.title: Control which values for NN are used in the ATR
field.name: Standard NN only
field.remark: The PC/SC workgroup maintains a list of Contactless memory cards, and defines a NN value for every registered card technology. Unfortunately, this list is not updated frequently and not exhaustive. The reader shall theoritically return NN=`0000` for all the cards that are not in list, but, to help application developers discriminate among card technologies, SpringCard readers have a more complete list (non-PC/SC values being above `F000`).

option.title: Use all NN entries defined by SpringCard to cover all Contactless memory cards
Use only NN entries specified by PC/SC workgroup, return NN=0000 for non-PC/SC cards

field.title: AFI for NFC-B polling
field.name: AFI
field.description: The AFI (Application Family IDentifier) is a parameter broadcasted by the reader within its NFC-B REQB/WUPB polling frames. A card that does not belong to the specified Application Family remains silent (this aims to speed-up the anti-collision loop and avoid the reader to initiate a transaction with "useless" cards).
field.remark: Set to `00` to target all cards (default)

field.title: NFC Forum polling: bail-out after NFC-F response
field.name: Bail-out

field.title: Control NFC-F bitrate: 212 and/or 424kbit/s
field.name: Bitrate

field.title: System Code for NFC-F polling
field.name: System Code
field.description: The System Code is a parameter broadcasted by the reader within its NFC-F polling frames. A card that does not belong to the specified System remains silent (this aims to speed-up the anti-collision loop and avoid the reader to initiate a transaction with "useless" cards).
field.remark: Set to `FFFF` to target all cards (default)

field.title: Request Code for NFC-F polling
field.name: Request Code
field.remark: Set to `01` for NFC Forum Type 3 Tag compliance (default)

field.title: Service Code used by READ BINARY with NFC-F cards
field.name: Read Service
field.description: For NFC-F cards, the reader's APDU Interpreter has to translate the ISO/IEC 7816-4 READ BINARY INStruction into a command that is understandable by the target FeliCa card. The Service Code to be used depends on the card's application and configuration.
field.remark: Set to `000B` for NFC Forum Type 3 Tag compliance (default)

field.title: Service Code used by UPDATE BINARY with NFC-F cards
field.name: Write Service
field.description: For NFC-F cards, the reader's APDU Interpreter has to translate the ISO/IEC 7816-4 UPDATE BINARY INStruction into a command that is understandable by the target FeliCa card. The Service Code to be used depends on the card's application and configuration.
field.remark: Set to `0009` for NFC Forum Type 3 Tag compliance (default)

field.title: AFI for NFC-V polling
field.name: AFI
field.description: The AFI (Application Family IDentifier) is a parameter broadcasted by the reader within its NFC-V polling frames. A card that does not belong to the specified Application Family remains silent (this aims to speed-up the anti-collision loop and avoid the reader to initiate a transaction with "useless" cards).
field.remark: Set to `00` to target all cards (default)

field.title: Min. polling interval (10th of second)
field.name: Poll interval
field.description: Use this parameter to slow down the reader (this is the first step to reduce average power consumption).
field.remark: If set to `00` (default), the reader operates at maximum speed.

field.title: Min. time before restarting polling after card removal (10th of second)
field.name: Wait after poll
field.description: Use this parameter if the host system is unable to handle a new card immediately after the previous one.
field.remark: If set to `00` (default), the reader doesn't add a pause after a card removal.

field.title: Shutdown RF if a card remains in the field during a long time (seconds)
field.name: Protect card
field.description: Use this parameter to prevent a card from overheating (and maybe being destroyed) if it stays in the RF field for a long time.
field.remark: If set to `00` (default), the reader never stops the RF field while a card is present.

register.description: A PC/SC reader features an APDU interpreter to expose wired-logic, memory-only cards as if they were compliant with ISO/IEC 7816-4.
